abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for Montenegro second structural
            adjustment credit were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was low or
            negligible, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Lessons
            learned from the project: A strong analytical basis is
            needed to design effective operations. Small steps in
            extending the Credit's closing date can be effective in
            helping the government achieve a difficult benchmark. Reform
            implementation crucially depends on an effective champion. A
            pro-active role for the government in monitoring agreed
            outcome indicators and achieving benchmarks is crucial. This
            should help ensure smooth implementation of the project,
            build government capacity and strengthen cooperation with
            the Bank.
